basicInfo.parentCompany: Independent (publicly traded; owned by Apollo Global Management since 2016)
basicInfo.notes: Founded 1998 in San Antonio, TX. Pioneer of managed cloud hosting. Known for 'Fanatical Support' brand. Went private in 2016 via Apollo Global Management acquisition for $4.3B. Re-IPO in 2020. Focuses on multi-cloud managed services for enterprises. 6,800+ employees globally.

pricing.moneyBackExclusions: Enterprise contracts; no traditional refund policy

support.prioritySupportCost: Included in managed plans; varies by SLA tier

policiesOverages.hiddenFeesNotes: Premium pricing for managed services; Support quality reported as declining post-outsourcing; Complex enterprise contracts; Best for large enterprises needing multi-cloud management

contentRestrictions.contentNotes: Enterprise-focused; strict AUP for managed services

editorial.knownIssues: Very poor Trustpilot rating (1.2) despite 'Fanatical Support' brand; Support quality reportedly declined after outsourcing; Expensive for what you get; Complex contracts; Slow response times reported; Not suitable for small businesses; Apollo acquisition led to cost-cutting
editorial.bestFor: Large enterprises needing multi-cloud management; Organizations requiring managed services across AWS/Azure/GCP; Companies needing 24/7 expert support; Compliance-heavy industries
editorial.avoidIf: Small business or startup; Need affordable hosting; Want simple self-service; Budget-conscious; Need quick support responses
editorial.competitorComparisonNotes: Pioneer of managed hosting but struggling; G2 4.2 reflects enterprise satisfaction but Trustpilot 1.2 shows customer frustration; 'Fanatical Support' brand undermined by outsourcing; Expensive vs DIY cloud; Competes with Cloudways, managed AWS/Azure services

comparisonData.uniqueSellingPoint: Multi-cloud managed services provider with 'Fanatical Support' across AWS, Azure, and GCP
comparisonData.idealCustomerProfile: Enterprise needing managed multi-cloud services with 24/7 support and compliance requirements

faqContent.faqIsThisHostGood: Rackspace was a pioneer in managed hosting but has struggled recently. G2 4.2 reflects some enterprise satisfaction, but Trustpilot 1.2 shows significant customer frustration with support quality decline.
faqContent.faqWhoOwnsThisHost: Rackspace Technology is owned by Apollo Global Management since 2016 ($4.3B acquisition). Re-IPO in 2020. Headquartered in San Antonio, TX.
faqContent.faqHowMuchDoesItCost: Enterprise pricing; dedicated servers from $199/month. Managed cloud services are custom quoted. Not budget-friendly.
faqContent.faqIsItBeginnerFriendly: No. Rackspace targets enterprises and is expensive. Better options exist for small businesses and beginners.
faqContent.faqDoesItIncludeEmail: Yes, Rackspace Email is available as a managed service with 25GB mailboxes.
faqContent.faqCanIHostWordPress: Not optimized for WordPress. Better to use Cloudways or other managed WordPress hosts.
faqContent.faqWhatsTheUptime: Rackspace offers 100% uptime SLA with service credits for downtime.
faqContent.faqCanICancelAnytime: Depends on contract terms. Enterprise agreements may have minimum commitments.
